Find central points of a group

Source: R/cell_filtering.R
filter_central_cells_from_group.Rd

Given a population of cells and a UMAP embedding, this function attempts to identify a group of cells that are located in the centre of this group. For this, the function calculates the geometric median of the UMAP and then calculates the nearest points to this point.

Usage

filter_central_cells_from_group(cell_group, umap_embedding, n_points = 5)

Arguments

cell_group

A vector with the names of the cells to be analysed.

umap_embedding

A matrix with the UMAP embedding of the cells. The matrix should have defined the rownames as the cell names.

n_points

The number of points to be selected as the central points.

Value

A vector with the names of the cells that are considered central.
